maml:description.maml:para: Turns off the identification LED on a storage enclosure or the slots for individual disks.

The Disable-StorageEnclosureIdentification cmdlet turns off the identification LED on the specified storage enclosure and, optionally, on the slots for individual disks. Administrators typically use LEDs to locate a physical disk in an enclosure for removal or replacement. This cmdlet requires a storage enclosure that supports SCSI Enclosure Services (SES).
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the enclosures that the names specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDsfor the enclosures that the IDs specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the enclosures that the names specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet turns off the identification LEDsfor the enclosures that the IDs specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
This cmdlet does not generate any output. If you specify the Passthru parameter, the cmdlet returns an array of MSFT_StorageEnclosure objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: ------ Example 1: Disable identification of an enclosure ------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables identification for the enclosure named E11.

command:example.maml:title: - Example 2: Disable identification of specified slot numbers -

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command disables identification for the slots numbers 20 and 14 of the enclosure named E11.

maml:description.maml:para: Enables the identification LED on a storage enclosure or the slots for individual disks.

The Enable-StorageEnclosureIdentification cmdlet enables the identification LED on the specified storage enclosure and, optionally, on the slots for individual disks. Administrators typically use LEDs to locate a physical disk in an enclosure for removal or replacement. This cmdlet requires a storage enclosure that supports SCSI Enclosure Services (SES).
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet turns on the identification LED for the enclosures that the names specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns on the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns on the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns on the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet turns on the identification LED for the enclosures that the IDs specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet turns on the identification LED for the enclosures that the names specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects. By default, this cmdlet does not generate any output.
Specifies an array of slot numbers. This cmdlet turns on the identification LEDs for the slots that the numbers identify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet turns on the identification LED for the enclosures that the IDs specify or for slots that belong to the specified enclosures.
This cmdlet does not generate any output by default. If you specify the PassThru parameter, the cmdlet returns an array of MSFT_StorageEnclosure objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Enable identification of an enclosure -------

maml:description.maml:para: Gets storage enclosures.
The Get-StorageEnclosure cmdlet gets storage enclosures that are visible to your computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures that the names specify.
Specifies the serial number of the storage enclosure to get.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.

Specifies a physical disk as a CimInstance object. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures that contain the disk that the object specifies. To obtain a physical disk object, use the Get-PhysicalDisk cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets storage enclosures that are physically connected to a storage node.

Specifies a storage node as a CimInstance object. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures connected to the storage node that the object specifies. To obtain a storage node object, use the Get-StorageNode cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.

Specifies a storage subsystem as a CimInstance object. This cmdlet gets storage enclosures that belong to the subsystem that the object specifies. To obtain a storage subsystem object, use the Get-StorageSubSystem cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that the IDs specify.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures that the names specify.
Specifies an array of health status values. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
- Healthy
- Warning
- Unhealthy
- Unknown
Health status describes the health of an enclosure. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that have health statuses that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the name of a manufacturer. This cmdlet gets enclosures for the manufacturers that this parameter identifies.
Specifies an array of model IDs. This cmdlet gets enclosures that the model IDs specify.

Specifies a physical disk as a CimInstance object. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures that contain the disk that the object specifies. To obtain a physical disk object, use the Get-PhysicalDisk cmdlet.
Indicates that this cmdlet gets storage enclosures that are physically connected to a storage node.
Specifies the serial number of the storage enclosure to get.

Specifies a storage node as a CimInstance object. The cmdlet gets storage enclosures connected to the storage node that the object specifies. To obtain a storage node object, use the Get-StorageNode cmdlet.

Specifies a storage subsystem as a CimInstance object. This cmdlet gets storage enclosures that belong to the subsystem that the object specifies. To obtain a storage subsystem object, use the Get-StorageSubSystem cmdlet.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet gets the enclosures that the IDs specify.
This cmdlet returns an array of StorageEnclosure objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: * When used in Failover Cluster, cmdlets from the Storage module operate on cluster level (all servers in the cluster).

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the enclosures visible to your computer.

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 2: Get an enclosure by using a friendly name -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the enclosure named E1.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 3: Get an enclosure by using an ID ----------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the enclosure that has the specified UniqueId .
This command gets enclosures that have the health status of Unhealthy.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 5: Get enclosures from a manufacturer --------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets enclosures from a specific manufacturer.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 6: Get an enclosure that contains a specified disk --

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the Get-PhysicalDisk cmdlet to get the disk named PhysicalDisk35, and then passes that object to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. The current cmdlet gets the enclosure that contains the disk named PhysicalDisk35.

command:example.maml:title: ----- Example 7: Get enclosures attached to a storage node -----

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the Get-StorageNode cmdlet to get the storage node named Node14, and then passes that object to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. The current cmdlet gets enclosures attached to the node named Node14.

command:example.maml:title: ----------- Example 8: Get enclosures on a subsystem -----------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Get-StorageSubSystem -FriendlyName "Clustered storage spaces on main cluster" | Get-StorageEnclosure

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the Get-StorageSubSystem cmdlet to get the storage subsystem that has the specified friendly name, and then passes that object to the current cmdlet by using the pipeline operator. The current cmdlet gets enclosures on the specified subsystem.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets vendor-specific data for an enclosure.
The Get-StorageEnclosureVendorData cmdlet gets vendor-specific data for a storage enclosure. Specify the enclosure and the SCSI diagnostic page code for the data.
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet gets vendor data for the enclosures that the names specify.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

Runs the cmdlet in a remote session or on a remote computer. Enter a computer name or a session object, such as the output of a New-CimSession (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227967) or [Get-CimSession](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=227966)cmdlet. The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies the SCSI diagnostic page code for which this cmdlet gets vendor-specific information.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.

The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.

The default is the current session on the local computer.

Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet gets vendor data for the enclosures that the IDs specify.
Runs the cmdlet as a background job. Use this parameter to run commands that take a long time to complete.

The default is the current session on the local computer.
Specifies an array of friendly names. This cmdlet gets vendor data for the enclosures that the names specify.
Specifies the input object that is used in a pipeline command.
Specifies the SCSI diagnostic page code for which this cmdlet gets vendor-specific information.

Specifies the maximum number of concurrent operations that can be established to run the cmdlet. If this parameter is omitted or a value of `0` is entered, then Windows PowerShell® calculates an optimum throttle limit for the cmdlet based on the number of CIM cmdlets that are running on the computer. The throttle limit applies only to the current cmdlet, not to the session or to the computer.
Specifies an array of IDs. This cmdlet gets vendor data for the enclosures that the IDs specify.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Get information for an enclosure ---------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets vendor data for the enclosure named E11. The cmdlet specifies SCSI diagnostic page code 0x2.
